meanings.definition: To attract or captivate with charm or enchantment.
meanings.sent1: The young child was becharmed by the colorful magic show.
meanings.sent2: The singer becharmed the audience with her beautiful voice.
meanings.sent3: The puppy becharmed everyone with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The old book becharmed readers with its timeless story.
meanings.sent5: The garden becharmed visitors with its blooming flowers.

meanings.definition: To cast a spell over someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The wizard becharmed the potion to make it powerful.
meanings.sent2: The witch becharmed the broom to fly through the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The magician becharmed the hat to produce endless rabbits.
meanings.sent4: The enchantress becharmed the castle to protect it from harm.
meanings.sent5: The sorcerer becharmed the crystal ball to reveal the future.

meanings.definition: To be under the influence of a charm or enchantment.
meanings.sent1: The princess was becharmed by the evil sorcerer's curse.
meanings.sent2: The knight was becharmed by the enchanting melody of the harp.
meanings.sent3: The traveler was becharmed by the mysterious aura of the forest.
meanings.sent4: The explorer was becharmed by the hidden treasure map.
meanings.sent5: The student was becharmed by the captivating history lesson.
